title: Riot, are you getting rid of crit during the marksman update?
body:
I'll be frank, the stat should've been removed at the same time you removed dodge.
But time moves on and that's not quite relevant. All that remains is that crit's an awful stat. It makes a ridiculous power curve for ranged AD's that hits them mid game and makes the flat ridiculous late.
You'll never really get away from the fact it's a entirely luck based stat in a skill based game. 
And it makes AD itemization extremely wonky.

In terms of reasons why it shouldn't be removed, I believe I've only heard one.
"But what about ranged AD's?"

It seems you're working on the mandatory class at the moment. So, really, there's no better time to right the mistakes of the past.
So're we gettin' rid of crit now? Timing's perfect, water's warm.

I agree with this, as crit is necessary to the power of marksmen right now and has a ton of potential to be a lot more interesting, but currently is just a lot of power without any real gameplay, and is especially frustrating due to its dependence on RNG (or pseudo-RNG, at least).

For all the hate people have given towards three-strike passives and effects, I think that could be the perfect model for crit, as it's dependent on autoattacks, the core marksman mechanic, carries a lot of gameplay, and could potentially have the sort of power we see on Hyper, Silver Bolts, Denting Blows, etc. Additionally, it could also allow crits to expand beyond marksmen, as we already have non-AD champions like Ekko, Tahm Kench and Diana who have similar effects. Farther down, incorporating ability hits into crit would allow spell-based marksmen to always be successful when spell-weaving, instead of having spells that don't feel too spectacular compared to regular autoattacks.

I used to support that idea as well. While a system like that would solve the issue of RNG, my issue with it is that it still ultimately doesn't add any more gameplay to crit as a stat. Marksmen would have more consistent damage, but would lose out on the explosive damage that made crits impressive (though their randomness can make those frustrating as well). It also means there would still not be much you could do with the stat: AD feels natural to add into scalings, attack speed has a visible effect on gameplay, but a straight-up autoattack multiplier doesn't feel like it has any application besides... well, multiplying autoattacks. By contrast, a three-strike system would keep the explosive bursts of damage associated with crit while adding a ton of gameplay, and could allow for that power to translate into other bonuses besides just raw damage (you could get a burst of speed every time you get a crit, for example, or your crits could even CC enemies), something that would be difficult to achieve on a persistent buff.
